senses.de: To give something like money, time, ideas or efforts to help achieve or provide something.
senses.ex: He contributes generously to the local charity every year.

Tips.title: Helping Others
Tips.description: To contribute often means supporting others in need or a common cause through various means.
Tips.example: Many people contribute their time by volunteering at food banks.

Tips.title: Beyond Money
Tips.description: While donating money is common, contributing can also be about sharing knowledge or skills.
Tips.example: He contributed his programming skills to the open-source project.

senses.de: To play a significant part in making something happen.
senses.ex: His research has contributed greatly to the advancement of technology.

Tips.title: Active Participation
Tips.description: When contributing to a project or cause, it involves active engagement and effort, not just agreement.
Tips.example: By conducting experiments, she contributed to the scientific community's understanding of the phenomenon.

Tips.title: Impacting Outcomes
Tips.description: Contributing implies that your actions have a meaningful impact on the outcome of a situation.
Tips.example: Their innovative ideas contributed to the project's success.

senses.de: To write pieces for a newspaper, magazine, or website.
senses.ex: She often contributes articles to the local newspaper.

Tips.title: Creative Contributions
Tips.description: Contributing in journalism means adding your creations like articles or photos to a publication.
Tips.example: After the trip, he contributed a photo essay to the magazine.

Tips.title: Recognition
Tips.description: Writers who contribute regularly may gain recognition and become known for their expertise.
Tips.example: As she contributed more articles, her name became well-known among the readers.

senses.de: To pay money to a common fund or for a common purpose.
senses.ex: Employees are required to contribute towards their pension fund.

Tips.title: Shared Responsibility
Tips.description: Contributing financially often means sharing the cost of something with a group for a mutual benefit.
Tips.example: All club members contribute to the annual party fund.

Tips.title: Obligation
Tips.description: Sometimes contributing is mandatory, like in taxes or retirement funds, not just voluntary.
Tips.example: The law states that employers must contribute to their employees' health insurance.

Bestow.wordDefinition:
Bestow means to give or present something as a gift or an honor.

It is used when someone wants to express a sense of greatness or admiration towards what has been given. For example, one might bestow an award or an honorary degree to a recipient.

In simplest terms, bestow relates to giving something as a gift or an honor, while contribute relates to giving something to help achieve a larger goal or purpose.

Donate.wordDefinition:
To donate means to give something, especially money or goods, to a cause, program or an organization without expecting anything in return.

For example, you can donate money to a charity to help fund a cause or provide food and supplies for those in need.

Both contribute and donate are interchangeable in many cases, but donate is often used specifically for giving money, while contribute is used generally for giving anything of value to a specific effort or cause.

Furnish.wordDefinition:
Both contribute and furnish mean to provide something, but the context in which they are used varies.

Furnish is used when someone provides something for a specific purpose or need, like providing furniture for a new home or office.

Contribute is used more for charitable or helpful purposes, while furnish is used more for practical or necessary purposes.

Give.wordDefinition:
However, contribute suggests an act of giving that is more intentional, purposeful and often involves participation, involvement or collaboration towards a particular goal or purpose.

For example, you might contribute money to a charity, or contribute your time and effort towards a school project. Give is a more general term that simply means to hand over or provide something to someone.

You might give someone a gift or give someone directions.

Grant.wordDefinition:
Grant, on the other hand, refers to giving someone permission or approval, often in the form of a financial award.

For example, a government may grant funding to a non-profit organization or a university may grant a scholarship to a student.

Grant is typically used in official or legal contexts, such as government funding or academic scholarships.

Offer.wordDefinition:
The main difference between contribute and offer is the intention behind the action.

"Offer means to present something as an option or solution, usually without any expectation of reciprocation or impact.

For example, someone may offer to help a friend move furniture, or offer their opinion on a topic without actively contributing to a decision.

To summarize: contribute implies a deeper commitment and intention towards achieving an objective, while offer suggests a more general willingness to be helpful or accommodate someone else's needs.

Participate.wordDefinition:
Contribute means to add or give something to a particular cause or project, whereas participate means to take part in an activity, event or discussion.

On the other hand, participating in a class discussion means actively engaging by asking questions or sharing opinions.

Contribute is more focused on giving or providing something, while participate is more focused on actively involving oneself in an activity or discussion.

Provide.wordDefinition:
Both words refer to giving something, but contribute suggests a collective effort towards a common goal, while provide suggests an individual act of giving something that is needed or requested by someone.

For example, a group of people can contribute money to charity, but a person can provide food for their family.

Supply.wordDefinition:
Supply means to provide something that is needed or required, often in a more direct and specific way. For example, a grocery store supplies food and household items to customers.

Contribute is more about giving something as a part of a bigger effort, while supply is about providing something that is needed or required directly.

quotes.Text: Obviously, I feel a great sense of responsibility being a good parent and raising my children. I don't take that job very lightly. Who they are, what they become and what they contribute to the world is very important to me.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Madonna Ciccone

quotes.Text: Having a mind that is open to everything and attached to nothing seems to me to be one of the most basic principles that you can adopt to contribute to individual and world peace.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Wayne Dyer

quotes.Text: If you and I are having a single thought of violence or hatred against anyone in the world at this moment, we are contributing to the wounding of the world.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Deepak Chopra

quotes.Text: I was lucky to be involved and get to contribute to something that was important, which is empowering people with software.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Bill Gates

quotes.Text: Babe Ruth was not afraid to strike out. And it was this fearlessness that contributed to his remarkable career.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Simon Sinek

quotes.Text: When you become successful in any type of life, there are people who are not contributing to the motion.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Tom Cruise

quotes.Text: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.Text: To merely observe your culture without contributing to it seems very close to existing as a ghost.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.Text: I contribute my best in my sport and I also have a ton of respect for myself and my family.
quotes.Title: American Tennis Player
quotes.Name: Venus Williams

quotes.Text: Peace can be contributed to by respect for our ability in defense.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Herbert Hoover
